steps.name: log
steps.title: Log
steps.description: Log messages to the underlying logging mechanism.

parameters.title: Logger Name
parameters.description: Name of the logging category to use

parameters.title: Group Active Only
parameters.description: If true, will hide stats when no new messages have been received for a time interval, if false, show stats regardless of message traffic.

parameters.title: Group Delay
parameters.description: Set the initial delay for stats (in millis)

parameters.title: Group Interval
parameters.description: If specified will group message stats by this time interval (in millis)

parameters.title: Group Size
parameters.description: An integer that specifies a group size for throughput logging.

parameters.title: Level
parameters.description: Logging level to use. The default value is INFO.

parameters.title: Log Mask
parameters.description: If true, mask sensitive information like password or passphrase in the log.

parameters.title: Marker
parameters.description: An optional Marker name to use.

parameters.title: Plain
parameters.description: If enabled only the body will be printed out

parameters.title: Source Location Logger Name
parameters.description: If enabled then the source location of where the log endpoint is used in Camel routes, would be used as logger name, instead of the given name. However, if the source location is disabled or not possible to resolve then the existing logger name will be used.

parameters.title: Lazy Start Producer
parameters.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

parameters.title: Exchange Formatter
parameters.description: To use a custom exchange formatter

parameters.title: Max Chars
parameters.description: Limits the number of characters logged per line.

parameters.title: Multiline
parameters.description: If enabled then each information is outputted on a newline.

parameters.title: Show All
parameters.description: Quick option for turning all options on. (multiline, maxChars has to be manually set if to be used)

parameters.title: Show All Properties
parameters.description: Show all of the exchange properties (both internal and custom).

parameters.title: Show Body
parameters.description: Show the message body.

parameters.title: Show Body Type
parameters.description: Show the body Java type.

parameters.title: Show Cached Streams
parameters.description: Whether Camel should show cached stream bodies or not (org.apache.camel.StreamCache).

parameters.title: Show Caught Exception
parameters.description: If the exchange has a caught exception, show the exception message (no stack trace). A caught exception is stored as a property on the exchange (using the key org.apache.camel.Exchange#EXCEPTION_CAUGHT) and for instance a doCatch can catch exceptions.

parameters.title: Show Exception
parameters.description: If the exchange has an exception, show the exception message (no stacktrace)

parameters.title: Show Exchange Id
parameters.description: Show the unique exchange ID.

parameters.title: Show Exchange Pattern
parameters.description: Shows the Message Exchange Pattern (or MEP for short).

parameters.title: Show Files
parameters.description: If enabled Camel will output files

parameters.title: Show Future
parameters.description: If enabled Camel will on Future objects wait for it to complete to obtain the payload to be logged.

parameters.title: Show Headers
parameters.description: Show the message headers.

parameters.title: Show Properties
parameters.description: Show the exchange properties (only custom). Use showAllProperties to show both internal and custom properties.

parameters.title: Show Stack Trace
parameters.description: Show the stack trace, if an exchange has an exception. Only effective if one of showAll, showException or showCaughtException are enabled.

parameters.title: Show Streams
parameters.description: Whether Camel should show stream bodies or not (eg such as java.io.InputStream). Beware if you enable this option then you may not be able later to access the message body as the stream have already been read by this logger. To remedy this you will have to use Stream Caching.

parameters.title: Skip Body Line Separator
parameters.description: Whether to skip line separators when logging the message body. This allows to log the message body in one line, setting this option to false will preserve any line separators from the body, which then will log the body as is.

parameters.title: Style
parameters.description: Sets the outputs style to use.

parameters.title: Step ID
parameters.description: Identifier of this step inside the route.
